website_summaries.verdict: A quality and very affordable otoscope. Unique removable penlight base can be used in different examination scenarios.
pros: Runs on two AAA batteries, which are included
Practical and functional piece of kit with high intensity LED light bulb
cons: Some users are concerned that it doesn't feel like a quality build

customer_reviews.title: I seriously want to use foul language here
customer_reviews.text: My family and I bought this to replace our old "Dr. Ear" brand we lost when our home flooded. The new one came today and I just used it for the first time. I seriously want to use foul language here, but for the sake of the review I will refrain. This Otoscope is laughable at best! The quality is no better than a child's toy and the light that is supposed in improve your vision in the ear canal is directly in front of your line of sight. It impeded 30% of the magnifier's view. Instead of seeing ear canal and drum, I see plastic light. Very poor design and very poor quality. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Uhapi Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad tool to have around the home,very good price compared to a professional scope!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, it was very inexpensive in comparison to a professional scope. I can see my daughters ear drum and any wax that may be effecting her hearing. It's a good tool to have around the home. NOTE: If you appreciated this review please give it a “thumbs up/like” your helping me to continue to give honest/unbiased insight into products I’ve used and you may have questions about. Interested in a product but don't know enough about it and would like it reviewed? Please let me know and I'll see what I can do... Thank you 🙏
customer_reviews.author: Symbols Of LoveTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Useless junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. I have to hold it with both hands so I can twist and apply pressure for the light to work and the light barely reaches the tympanic membrane. I tried adjusting and replacing batteries with no improvement. Cheap junk. Useless. I just bought a better brand, should've done it from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Flawed by design
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this to behave like my good ones... it was just a cheap tool to keep in the cabinet incase I needed to look at one if the kids eyes real fast or whatnot... However I do expect it to stay on... you have to hold so much pressure on the handle to keep the batteries in contact with the ends of the battery compartment that your hand cramps up. This tool is flawed by either poor design or poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Peters

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY low quality. Without holding this otoscope in your hand, it is hard to imagine how low quality it actually is. It is made out of light, very cheap plastic. The speculum constantly just falls off. There is no lens on the front of the otoscope, so the light reflector is in the open and easily bent. The lens on the back is not clear enough to be usable. It is like a toy that you would find at a dollar store. It is not worth more than a dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Maranatha

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: This is really basic & has a light, cheap, plastic-y feel. But, what do you expect for the price? I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product. The ear pieces fall off while you ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product. The ear pieces fall off while you are trying to look in the ear almost everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a great prop!
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews now, I was unaware that this was a legitimate otoscope at the time of my purchase. I bought this to go along with a doctor costume as a prop. Apparently it is real, so it looks very authentic. It feels like a cheap and lightweight plastic. The light works and the magnifying glass does its job. All-in-all, It's a great realistic looking prop that is fun to play with. 🤷🏾‍♀️Keep your expectations low.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: does not even function
customer_reviews.text: I knew from reading the reviews that this would not be top quality, but the light flickers so much that it is not even usable. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: maggie kantola

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk...do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: it does NOT work! the light will come on occasionally. I've tried 4 different sets of batteries. I've had it for quite a while but didn't need it until now and it DON'T WORK!! piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cone pops off
customer_reviews.text: Good and works except one minor irritant: the cone easily pops off when the four legged child flinches. Cone must have a thread screw design for five stars. Everything else is good; I like the small size and the inspection itself is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: scout

customer_reviews.title: It does not give a good view of the ear drum
customer_reviews.text: This is not medical grade. It does not give a good view of the ear drum. This may be user error, but I had to play with it to get use to learn the handle without causing pain. It would be good to see if something was not in the ear, but not for a diagnostic tool.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Sloat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a toy
customer_reviews.text: This otoscope is perfect for my intended purpose: a child's toy. My granddaughter has become obsessed with the concept of "doctor" and patient. She is working through a fear of the doc so I got this and a stethoscope. This otoscope is pretty cheap, when I look through the scope all I see is the light. If you really need to see inside someone's ear, spend more money and get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute piece of garbage. My son was able to break it within minutes of me opening the box. The attachments don’t stay on the end of the instrument, and the light doesn’t turn on consistently. Usually you have to shove the thing in their ear and push so hard to get the light to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Dafaid10

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Terrible everything on it is really cheap plastic the light loves to stay on the only way to turn it off is to either take the batteries out or put something in between the contact point you definitely get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: valois

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact and simple!
customer_reviews.text: Great for price point and what it is. To keep it on you have to apply pressure to the clip, like a pen light. Yes it's a learning curve for some. I've been a medical assistant for years and wanted something small, compact and cheap for my first aid kit and this is exactly what I was looking for. I can get a good view of my kids ear tubes and see any wax buildup.
customer_reviews.author: mxpxchic1

customer_reviews.title: I've had dollar store flashlights work better.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't mind the fact that it feels like a plastic toy if it actually worked. Trouble is, the light won't stay on. I literally could not get it where the device was in the ear canal and the light was on at the same time. I imagine it's a bit of a crap-shoot whether you get one that works or not with an item this cheap. But if the light had at least worked, I would have been MUCH happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: amf2

customer_reviews.title: It's been pretty cool looking in people's ears
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a real doctor play bag for my daughter. It's been pretty cool looking in people's ears. One of the tips is loose and has a sharp spot but it includes four sizes and for what its used for, great for us. Included batteries.
customer_reviews.author: SitterInTheCity

customer_reviews.title: I bought as a gift early. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.text: The item was a gift to my granddaughter who is studying to become a physician. Unfortunately we gave it to her as a gift on the 30th day after we received it. When she attempted to use it for the first time she discovered it was broken and unusable. By the way it’s appearance upon arrival was fine. There did not appear to be any damage. The product was just broken, inoperable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Extra tips is a plus! Touch activates!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a min to realize that the clip looking thing was the light. I was looking for a switch before it dawned on me that it was touch sensitive to activate light. Had to buy a new one since old one broke. This is a great tool for checking ears and it comes with extra tips so I give this product five stars for that!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: More of a Toy then Professional Use
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to get something more, but this otoscope did not turn out to be the quality I liked. The outside casing is made from plastic. Not heavy duty or something that will last long. The ear piece fits nicely in the ear. You can see little more than the basics. I can see the shapes, but I cannot really make out any details. If you are looking to purchase this for at home use, you might not get what you are looing for, however, if you are looking for a professional tool to be a toy, this one is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Lilith

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: There is no button to turn on the light and keep it on. That's extremely annoying. Also, the ear piece pops off way to easily, which is frustrating and potentially dangerous with a squirming toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good otoscope
customer_reviews.text: The first one didn't work, so the company sent me another one. The second one has been a life saver. It's a nice one that meets my needs. The light is hard to keep on though. It has to be held down while you try to look into your child's ear.
customer_reviews.author: Author SunflowerJ- @SHJ52111

customer_reviews.title: Low quality but works...
customer_reviews.text: Item is of course very cheap and very low quality product, but it worked for our needs. Light could be brighter and the specula often fall off. Just be careful when using this item. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: G. Currie

customer_reviews.title: The tips don't stay on very well and the actual head part that you look through comes off too easily. The light also flickers qu
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It works but it's very cheap. I actually bought it as a toy for my six year. The tips don't stay on very well and the actual head part that you look through comes off too easily. The light also flickers quite a bit. It works as a toy but I wouldn't recommend it for actual diagnostic use
customer_reviews.author: michelletmommyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: the worst product I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I'm a physician and needed this to use on a medical mission trip. Literally, the worst product I've ever used. The light hardly reaches the tympanic membrane. Therefore, one cannot properly evaluate the tympanic membrane and diagnose correctly. My mistake was going for the cheaper option. DO NOT PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kim

customer_reviews.title: Bought another brand and it worked a lot better. This is not a good one
customer_reviews.text: Bought another brand and it worked a lot better. This is not a good one. Pay more for a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More like a strobe light.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not enjoying that when I press to turn the light on it doesn't stay on and instead flickers; doesn't matter how hard you press the button or finger placement, it just seems to be of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Moms with little ones need this!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter constantly had issues with her ears. She eventually had to get tubes put it at 9 months old. I was so thankful to have this to know when she was in pain because of her ears then wasting the money to go into the doctor's office for them to tell me it was just teething. Definitely recommend every mom with young kids own one of these!
customer_reviews.author: LEA

customer_reviews.title: this was crap, with plastic lens
customer_reviews.text: this was crap, with plastic lens, very unclear. Cheaper to throw it in the trash than to return it. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Can you get better quality? Absolutely. But for this price-point this item works great. It is easy to see through and works as intended. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like its been used, beat up on the edges. Also came missing the batteries that were supposed to be included. Very displeased.
customer_reviews.author: Jbizil

customer_reviews.title: 4 TIMES ANS THATS ABOUT IT DONT WASTE YOUR TIME
customer_reviews.text: BREAKS AT THE DROP OF A HAT AT THE LITTLE REFLECTION THING THAT SHINES THE LIGHT INTO THE EAR BREAKS WHEN SWITCHING TOPS WORKED WELL FOR 3...4 TIMES ANS THATS ABOUT IT DONT WASTE YOUR TIME
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Very cheap. Hard to see. The speculum is an unusual size so you either need to clean/reuse them or buy the specific ones for this mediocre pen light.
customer_reviews.author: David Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for taking care of us Girls and Geckos here in Las Vegas!
customer_reviews.text: Quick Ship, Items as described! AAAAA+++++++ Sellers Thanks for taking care of us Girls and Geckos here in Las Vegas!
customer_reviews.author: Rion Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good transaction all together.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for someone in need as she began nursing school. She was thankful for her gift and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: NATHANIEL PEARCE

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: NEED NEW item is hard to see into ear if you need glasses to read you will need to see into ear lol almost can see same results with flash light and head tilted would not recommend to others reason for 3 stars very fast shipping and box where great maybe its just me
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Crude but effective.
customer_reviews.text: It did what i needed but the led won't stay lit easily and makes it difficult to use, but cheap and better than nothing checking on eartubes.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic not quality it should be a kids toy not a professional medical device
customer_reviews.text: Cheap not worth buying or returning shame shame shame...I think play school makes a better he in the kids doctors kit
customer_reviews.author: Luci Furr

customer_reviews.title: because it doesn't provide a good image. With that said
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. The lens on this is cheap. It is hard to use, because it doesn't provide a good image. With that said, it was cheap but did the job for what we needed. So I am glad we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: hweir

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a joke. No paper magnification. I wanted something real, not pretend...
customer_reviews.author: nicole baker-carson

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this for the price. I filed down one of the attachments so that it won't go into the ear canal at all. The purpose of this (for us) was to get my sons used to the feel of an otoscope for doctor appointments. It has helped with my son's phobia of doctors.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Buy a better one
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t magnify just light. Not impressed should have bought a more expensive one
customer_reviews.author: Lil Jesi

customer_reviews.title: You can't see very well with this. We got ...
customer_reviews.text: You can't see very well with this. We got it for just around the house, but I would suggest going with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great device for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter to play doctor with realistic tools. However we all soon found out how realistic it was and how dirty all our ears were. We also learned it’s important to have some ear wax, and not to use it all the time. Really impressed with the quality of the otoscope. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Millie Cohen

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a life saver! Once you know how to position it and know what you're looking for, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Stanfill

customer_reviews.title: the light is nice and bright and I can see well but the ...
customer_reviews.text: the light is nice and bright and I can see well but the tips fall of when I try to move it in the ear to see better. I can't use it to clean the ear and hold it back at the same time. Which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Coulombe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting was hard to figure out how to use very cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Ludemom

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for... this item is very cheap
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Glad I only had to use on one person, it helped me pass my assessment course in college. I had to do a video assessment to show I know how to use but it kept falling apart. Would never use during a patient exam.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage. I realize it was $6
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. I realize it was $6.00, however, I thought I could at least get a quick view of my daughter's ear, but not so much. Light goes off and on and the funnel piece won't stay on. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic thingy. Cone attachment keeps falling off. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic thingy. Cone attachment keeps falling off. But you can see inside the ear. Same level you can get in the pharmacy.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: It's annoying you have to continually press down for light
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap otoscope it is OK. It's annoying you have to continually press down for light, and can't just keep the light on as needed. Comes in a little box, not a case, which was somewhat sad.
customer_reviews.author: Abreeanah

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. I’m working on getting a real one. The ear piece does not stay on. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Ondrea Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy. The connection is loose and pen light ...
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy. The connection is loose and pen light doesn't stay on keep turning off before I have a chance to even look into the ear .
customer_reviews.author: Helena K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's great, but sometimes the black scopes fall off when looking in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Mademoiselle

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and is worth the money however to turn on the light you have to be pressing the metal clip down and it can sometimes lose contact with the metal while in use causing the light to flicker
customer_reviews.author: B Knight

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Not professional grade, but good enough to adequately visualize the tympanic membrane. For 6 bucks, its good enough.
customer_reviews.author: blabla

customer_reviews.title: I'm an NP and wanted something cheap to check my ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an NP and wanted something cheap to check my baby's ears at home. This is far from professional grade, but if you know what you are looking for it will do the job. No magnification. You get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: not the best quality. You get what you pay for though
customer_reviews.text: Works, but, not the best quality. You get what you pay for though.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is great! My kids are always saying their ears hurt, so now I can look before I take them to the dr. It has saved me my co pay a few times so far. :) I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. The lense is very clear and the light is bright enough to see. I highly recommend having one of these of hand if you have a child.
customer_reviews.author: Rich J. Stip

customer_reviews.title: Handy product to view ear.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to check in a tube that didn’t fall out in a timely manner. Worked for purpose purchases for. The light is touchy.
customer_reviews.author: Leesa

customer_reviews.title: but it was perfect to take on an international medical trip
customer_reviews.text: This otoscope is very cheap, but it functions, but it was perfect to take on an international medical trip. I ended up losing it the first day at one of our clinic sites, so I was glad not to have taken a very expensive otoscope! Probably best for learners, not for heavy clinic use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously cheaply made. You have to hold down the side button the entire time for the light to stay on. It is a good toy though.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cheep! works to intermittently and would break if it was dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: You get almost no light from this, so can't see in the hear. Very flimsily made.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Quintiliani

customer_reviews.title: The mini otoscope does exactly what's it made for. ...
customer_reviews.text: The mini otoscope does exactly what's it made for. It's not high quality material but that's ok for at home use. It works just as well as an expensive otoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Yeni

customer_reviews.title: Not fancy but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on schedule. Works as advertised. Meets the need for ear inspection. Not fancy, but does the job designed for.
customer_reviews.author: NC Reader

customer_reviews.title: For family use.
customer_reviews.text: this product is used to help determine of something is stuck in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: JR Cook

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give this 0 stars. My son has tubes in his ears and I was not able to see anything. This is more like a toy for kid
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheaply made. We just bought it for my daughter to play with since she likes to pretend to be a Dr.
customer_reviews.author: Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: My son has a lot of ear infection and has tubes. I like to see if he has a wax build up. Finally something that works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: Light doesn't work. Luckily I got it for my 5 yr old to play with
customer_reviews.author: SarahK

customer_reviews.title: only bad thing, it came with no instructions
customer_reviews.text: only bad thing, it came with no instructions, but I figured it out fast once I had the batteries in right.... just tap on the clip and the light goes on
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, magnifying lens is worthless, everything is blurry. Just bite the bullet and spend $20-30 on a decent one.
customer_reviews.author: Skecsies

customer_reviews.title: ... and u cannot see as far as i would like.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made and u cannot see as far as i would like.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kloxin

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with it for what I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, but works perfectly for at home use. I was happy with it for what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap like the price
customer_reviews.text: The covers fell off the otoscope when trying to look around in the ear. If you hold the covers on it gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McDonald

customer_reviews.title: For a cheap buy it does enough to satisfy. The switch is the hanger thing
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap buy it does enough to satisfy. The switch is the hanger thing. I do agree that directions would have benefited everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough for me to see if my daughter has wax build-up or pus on her ear drum.
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: Kids doctor set works good enough
customer_reviews.text: Daughters doctor kit dont really use the tips are cheap and flimsy but who cares didnt buy it to actually use just for play.
customer_reviews.author: Clint R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for at home use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It is great for at home use. That being said, don't expect professional quality. It is plastic, but it does the job that it was meant to do. The comes on automatically and is bright enough to see down in the ear canal. It also comes with disposable covers. You only get three, but for the price that is a pretty good deal. It also comes with the batteries, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: good enough
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I didn’t expect much. I used this for a health assessment video for school and can see the ear structure fairly well. I was honestly surprised. It is a good tool to help decide when to take the kiddos in for an ear infection.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chedester

customer_reviews.title: Good otoscope for the price but the light blinks constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: Good otoscope for the price but the light blinks constantly when the button is pushed to turn on the light.
customer_reviews.author: b hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for about a year
customer_reviews.text: It works but it's cheap. If you are looking for something long lasting don't waste your time here
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Light issue
customer_reviews.text: The light doesn't come on unless you push it against the ear. That doesn't bother older kids or adults but does the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon Knox

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works but not in the good quality however matching the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: alfred shen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cleaning ears
customer_reviews.text: Nothing crazy, allows you to see into the ear canal. Perfect for cleaning ears.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGilmore

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Small, cheap feeling but works great for home use. We bought it to get our daughter a little more acquainted with doctor items so that she would quit freaking out at every appointment.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha D.

customer_reviews.title: Serves Basic Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Item does not come with/instructions, because it's simple to assemble and use...2-3 steps. Easy to use, when u figure out what the eardrum looks like. Sufficient for basic use.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist competent otoscope
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed; not too heavy, not too expensive, easily replaced, comes with batteries, works well. I would buy this again. Shipped well, on time, great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Thinking of You

customer_reviews.title: On/Off switch is flimsy at best.. I didn't expect too much from it
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done...but it does feel a bit on the cheap side. On/Off switch is flimsy at best.. I didn't expect too much from it, so it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Maximammx

customer_reviews.title: The push button for the light gets worn out very ...
customer_reviews.text: The push button for the light gets worn out very quickly and can be a pain to get to light up. But once its working, it allows you to see straight in the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Kinda cheap. It’s a little hard to see through ...
customer_reviews.text: Kinda cheap. It’s a little hard to see through but if you know exactly what to look for it works. The ear peice part keeps falling off though.
customer_reviews.author: MamaZ

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PIECES
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to get this in the mail today. Opened it up and waalaah no batteries. Now I know its not THAT big of deal but when the product says it includes certain items that aren't in the package, it becomes really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Similar view compared to professional models
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. Similar view compared to professional models, but perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith T. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Light goes on and off randomly making it extremely difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Gorgoglione

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price. It's a cheap one that can be used at home before rushing to the doctor. It is kinda flimsy but it is 8$ can't ask for a fantastic item for so cheap
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for a child playing pretend
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a five-star review as someone who purchased this as a play-item for my 7-year-old daughter. Easy to use for a child playing pretend, although I am not sure how well it holds up in a professional setting, but I am happy for what I use it for!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Primacare DL-4112 Mini Diagnostic Otoscope Kit with LED - Black
product_meta.description:
The Primacare medical examination Otoscope is the ultimate diagnostic tool. It can be used for ear, throat, and nose examinations to diagnose issues or illnesses. An instrument simple enough to diagnose sever infections and inflammation that may need further medical attention. The Primacare Otoscope is currently being used by thousands of Drs, patients, and medical students to ensure safe and detailed practices. This easy to use item measures 6” in total and is perfect for traveling and resilient enough to store in your pocket. Built in LED light for extreme brightness for accurate readings and a 3X magnification for easy to see diagnosis. 3 Different Speculum tips to ensure accuracy for all aged patients. Trust the number one selling Otoscope and trust Primacare for all of your medical needs. We guarantee you’ll be satisfied with this premium product.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
9084867050
feature_bullets: THE BEST OTOSCOPE AVAILABLE: Built for high quality performance and precise magnification. The Primacare Otoscope is the perfect size, quality, and price for the ultimate medical checkup. The perfect medical tool for training or on the job use.

CHANGEABLE EAR TIPS IN VARIOUS SIZES: Comes with 3 ear tip sizes that can easily be changed to screen different age groups. Speculum tips are made durable for multiple uses and easy to wash off after examinations

HIGH RESOULTION LED LIGHT & MAGNIFICATION: The quality Primacare 3X lens has fixed-focus magnification and bright LED lights to enhance medical diagnosis. Bright, efficient, and uses two AAA long lasting batteries that last for years. Removable penlight for multi-use examination purposes including throat, nose, and ear examination

PORTABLE AND AFFORDABLE: This Mini Otoscope is perfect for traveling and screening patients or family during travel. Never leave home without this vital diagnostic tool. Lightweight, compact, and the perfect price to buy multiple units for different locations.

USED BY STUDENTS & MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS: Utilized and loved by medical professionals as the number one choice in Otoscope brands. Powerful enough to asses’ patients with certainty and pass various exams. Thousands of satisfied users agree Primacare is their number one choice for medical supplies and Otoscopes.
